title: Using Costco Salmon for Sushi

items.name: Use farmed Atlantic salmon
items.details: The common Costco farmed Atlantic salmon fillets are the safest option for raw consumption.

items.name: Freeze before eating raw
items.details: Freeze solid at -4F / -20C for at least 7 days (home freezer standard) to kill parasites.

items.name: Avoid wild salmon
items.details: Wild salmon has a higher parasite risk and should not be used raw.

items.name: Thaw in the fridge
items.details: After freezing, thaw the salmon in the refrigerator before preparing.

items.name: Trim and serve same day
items.details: Trim off surface flesh, bloodline, and skin. Slice cleanly and eat the same day.

items.name: Avoid unclear frozen labels
items.details: Anything labeled 'previously frozen' without knowing the freezing temps/time should not be trusted for raw use.

notes: Costco salmon is fine for sushi if it is farmed Atlantic and you freeze it yourself first. For zero hassle, a Japanese or fish market selling explicitly sushi-grade fish is the safer, easier route.
